intro: Quercus sessilis var. acutiloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sessile oak, is a deciduous tree native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its elongated, acute leaves that are typically 5–10 cm in length. The leaves are usually dark green on the upper surface and lighter green underneath, with a smooth margin. The tree produces small, cup-shaped acorns that are often covered with a dense, velvety cap. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
